meanings.definition: A person who counts or keeps track of something.
meanings.sent1: The talliers at the store counted the inventory carefully.
meanings.sent2: The talliers in the library keep track of the borrowed books.
meanings.sent3: The talliers at the zoo made sure all the animals were accounted for.
meanings.sent4: The talliers in the game of hide and seek were the ones who found everyone first.
meanings.sent5: The talliers in the competition meticulously recorded each participant's score.

meanings.definition: A group of people who count or keep track of something.
meanings.sent1: The talliers gathered around the table to tally the votes.
meanings.sent2: The talliers in the company ensured the financial records were accurate.
meanings.sent3: The talliers at the party made sure everyone had a drink in hand.
meanings.sent4: The talliers in the forest counted the trees to estimate the age of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The talliers in the classroom helped the teacher keep track of attendance.
